alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:48PM EST until February 01 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... River Raisin At Monroe City affecting Monroe County. For the River Raisin...including Tecumseh, Adrian, Blissfield, Dundee, Monroe City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...River Raisin at Monroe City. * WHEN...From late Monday night to Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:19 PM EST Sunday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning to a crest of 9.2 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Impact...At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins at the Monroe YMCA. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1100 AM EST.
